intro: Antirrhinum monspessulanum, commonly known as the common snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, tubular, two-lipped flowers that come in a wide range of colors, including red, yellow, and orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and has linear, hairy leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardeners. The flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
